text: Mike Bloomberg should man-up and fire sanitation workers in job slowdown during snow blizzard. A Reagan Patco moment.
Just had tough interview with Christine O'Donnell. Because I am a tea party supporter, I worry about her cred. And TP cred. CNBC @ 7pm.
Jobless claims fall to 388K. Biz loans small rise. More signs of econ recovery. But housing and $90 oil price/tax are still issues.
News reports that OB working on corp tax-rate cut in return for loophole closers. If so, big job gains, less offshoring, major econ boost.
China quotas and tariffs on rare earth minerals. China pushing US corps around. Is China waging economic cold war against US?
Bulls right, bears wrong in 2010. Double-dip wrong. Profits are mother's milk of stocks, biz and econ. Profits and steep curve=solid 2011.
Midnight mass @ St Paul's every year in Colo Springs. Beautiful. Lord my Savior. Redeemer. Clean and sober recoverer. God bless all of you.
Second big 2010 story: Bush tax-rates win, earmark omnibus spending monstrosity loses. Obamanomics dead in water.
Big story in 2010: Tea Party shellacks Obama. First big step to restoring free market capitalism and central role of entrepreneurship.
So, are there too many yearend bulls?Sentiment surveys show near 60% bulls, very high. December already up 6% for S&P500.
Stocks keep rising, especially since June. Profits, easy money, tea party election shift , tax cuts, steep curve, dollar more stable.
Sen Bob Corker wants to cap spending at 20%/GDP, with sequestration penalty for budget miss. Bravo. Deficit problem is spending problem.
$90 oil. $3 gas. Big numbers that hurt consumers and biz. Why is OB /Salazar stopping oil drilling off and on-shore? Drill, drill, drill!
Biden said Bush tax cuts repealed in 2012..So Prez campaign fight on class warfare? Go ahead, make my day. Flat tax reform best for growth.
Tea Party puts Reaganomics 2.0 back in the driver's seat. Free market populism. Less govt, limit spending, lower taxes. Very bullish.
OB shift right, tax cut deal, earmark spending defeat are all really bullish for stocks. Not bonds, stocks. Tea Party influence big bullish.
Tax cuts/budget restraint should curb FedQE2. Pro-growth fiscal policy will lower unemployment. Fed produces inflation and wrecks dollar.
GOP won historic votes with budget kill and huge tax cut pass. Complete change of econ policy to smaller gov and lower taxes. RR ends OB.
Tremendous GOP Senate win knocking out monstrosity omnibus budget. Win for voters and taxpayers.CR till early Feb, then 2008 freeze. Cool.
Sen. McCain told me minutes ago that if necessary he would shut down govt with filibuster in order to stop spending bill. Watch CNBC @7 pm!
Gingrich may be right: GOP should filibuster Monstrous spending bill. Will talk to McCain about it on CNBC tonight at 7 pm.
OB wants ceos to create jobs. But where's corp tax-rate cut? Or tax-free repatriation of foreign earnings already taxed abroad?
Will tax cuts end QE2? Treasury sell-off and yield rise may be from traders who see early end to Fed bond purchases. Plus strong econ.
Tame CPI and big ind production today. Blow-out retail sales. Tax cut coming. Maybe 4% growth 2011. Fed should junk QE2, save King Dollar.
Retail sales v QE2. Fed avoids mention of consumer miniboom.Rising 10-year rate is signaling Fed to raise short rate. But they won't.
House libs caving in to tax cut package! But Mitt Romney opposes. Huh? Gov, do you want an econ trainwreck? What's the wisdom?
Strong retail sales, PPI jump, long T-rates rising. Why do we need QE2? Zero target rate may be too low.FOMC talks at 2:15.
Tim Pawlenty reluctantly endorsed tax-cut package, acknowledging the warts. But he gets that rising tax-rates would doom econ. I agree.

I will ask Gov. Tim Pawlenty his take on tax cut package tonight on CNBC Kudlow Report at 7e. No GOP prez candidate has come out yet.
Va. judge ruling against OBCare mandate is hugely bullish. Single biggest job-killer. Stocks up on the news.
OB calling ceo meeting. Tax deal. S Korea trade deal. Personal and biz tax reform. Moving to economic center. Good for growth and stocks.
Got so worked up defending tax-rate incentives on radio that I just creamed the ball playing tennis afterwards. Thank heavens for tennis.
Spent radio defending tax cuts. Econ and stocks and jobs at stake. 90% of deal tax cuts. Spending paid for from unused stupid stimulus.
2 Dem presidents arguing for GOP prez George W. Bush's tax cuts. Hilarious!!! Delicious!!! And important for economy.
OB wants tax reform? To jack up taxes on corps and people to cut deficit? Flat tax reform must be revenue neutral. End loophole, low rates.
NYT reports that Obama is looking at flat tax reform for personal and corps. Broaden base, end loopholes and lower marginal rates. Wow.
Larry Summers right: failure on tax cuts could lead to double-dip. Should have told Obama 2 years ago, instead of failed spending stimulus.
Lefty House Dems holding up pro-growth tax cut deal and the stock market. These are the geniuses who lost 63 seats!
Supply-side tax cuts boost dollar and stocks and T yield. Depress gold. According to Howard Lutnick. I agree. Let's see if it works.
Biz Roundtable ceos favor tax bill. Expect modest econ boost. I ran a panel session in front of whole group in DC. Great fun. Real treat.
My old friend Howard Lutnick, indefatigable chairman/CEO of Cantor Fitzgerald will be special guest on tonight’s Kudlow Report. CNBC 7pm ET
Dollar +6% past year. S&P big caps +11%, small caps +28%. Don't need a falling dollar to rally stocks. King Dollar pro-growth.
Broadbased tax cuts + ultra easy Fed $$$ are powerful stimulants for stocks and the economy.
Also on the supply-side, the free-trade deal with S.Korea. OB is bowing to new GOP political reality. Progrowth tax cuts and free trade.
OB/GOP supply-side tax cut plan excellent. Biz investment 100% expensing. 35% estate. Investors win.  Growth. Incentives. USA wins.
Treasury bureau of engraving creates new dollar bills, but Fed creates new money/ reserves/cash thru bank bond buying . BB wrong. False.
FreedomWorks sound money conference in DC 12/7-Tuesday. DeMint, Ryan, Judy Shelton et al.US Capitol Hill Visitor Center, Rm SVC203-02.
Don't forget that capgains, dvy, estate and amt all up for grabs in tax bill. Hugely impt for growth. Fine print of deal is key.
OB/Dems lose class warfare tax votes in Senate. How ironic: GW Bush and his '03 tax cut will prevail. Splendid.
More on fiscal shock therapy to create jobs and restore confidence. Deep tax, spending and regulatory cuts.Paul Ryan can build right plan.
To get unemployment way down, we need shock therapy incentives from lower tax rates across board, including corps, dereg , and small gov't.
Poor jobs report with 9.8% unemployment. Maybe Dems will now work with GOP to rush through full extension of Bush tax cuts. Now.
Will more unemployment insurance create more unemployment? Subsidize something, you get more of it. Cut corp tax instead.
Econ awakening produces another big stock day. Retailing and housing up. Quiet Europe. Permanent tax cut xtension. Euro-dollar steady.
Fed's $3.3 trillion bailout nation report is outrage. Is there a bank that's not TBTF? Will bailout genie ever be stuffed back into bottle?
Better econ news sparks big stock gain. Tax cut extension also looking better. Bigger Euro bailout fund . China mfg also good. Global boom?
Bush tax-rate cut did not optimize jobs and growth because dollar collapsed 35%. Gold soared. Investment left. Inflation tax jumped to 6%.
Lower tax-rates and King Dollar is best policy for stocks, jobs and growth. Mundell/Laffer supply-side solution. But OB is not RR or JFK.
Obama edges closer to Bush tax cut extension deal with GOP. But $1m bracket a nonstarter for GOP. Stocks anxious over capgains/ dividends.
In an off-the-record dinner tonight, NJ Gov Chris Christie gave a brilliant talk centered on conservative Reagan principles. Extraordinary.
Mike Pence gives free-market barnburner to Detroit Econ Club. Spending limit, flat tax, Fed reform, dereg.  A presidential run?
Stronger US consumer and record biz profits will trump Euro debt problems. Ditto for Bush tax cut extension, which ignites stock rally.
Judy's conservative realist school art at AndersonFineArtGallery.com, or judithpondkudlow.com. Beautiful art.
Great pleasure to help wife Judy's new art show in Sea Island. Oil painting in the natural realism school. Conservative art. Beautiful art.
Last 4 flights to Salt Lake and Jacksonville and back to NYC: no problems with screening or patdowns. Is Peter King's TSA defense right?
Blessed Thanksgiving to friends, followers and everyone. God bless all. And God bless America.
Plunge in jobless claims to 407K suggests Nov  econ is rising after big jump in October.Dopey dopes in DC should xtend tax cuts for boom.
Part 2 Bush interview tonight. We strongly disagree about plunging King Dollar. And, did he really hold down spending? CNBC Kudlow. Thanks.
Stock market is a mess with N. Korea and Ireland. But revised GDP up, and profits are huge. Oct. econ strong. Tax cuts trigger big rally.
Irish debt problem has no systemic risk for US. Libor funding spreads haven't moved in interbank market. Extending tax cuts more important.
Still no deal on Bush tax cuts extension. Clock ticking. Is stock selling next? Dems in disarray. Class warriors will cause econ shipwreck
Pres Bush did not like stock market scorecard, nor 35% dollar drop and huge gold/oil rise on his watch. More on WABC and national radio.

In Salt Lake City. Getting ready to interview former President GWB right now. We'll begin airing interview Monday night at 7pm ET on CNBC.
Fed's completely wrong. Cease & desist. No deflation. Philly Fed mfg blowout, LEI, retail sales, factory output all show stronger economy.
Bernank told closed door Senate Banking meeting he'd rather fight than switch. Blamed China. No dollar dump. Believes deflation. Ugh. BLAH!
GM made IPO comeback look easy: Just give them $50b in taxpayer bailout. What about Fan, Fred, AIG, GMAC/Ally? Will Bailout Nation ever die?
On Friday, I will be first business and financial reporter to interview Pres.GWB on his book. Please suggest questions. Asking for help.
Tax cut extension breaking down in Senate leadership talks. Obama postpones Congress leaders meeting for two weeks. This will hurt stocks.
"Dollar Man" Tim Geithner comes out against extending tax cuts for wealthy. Did he not read newspapers about election? What's going on here?
New Irish debt crisis props up the dollar. And takes Fed off the hook. But it's only temporary.
Is Fed bankrupting govt, destroying King Dollar; 2nd rate currency, 2nd rate econ, losing the economic cold war? Is the Fed next bailout?

GOP econs rip Fed for QE2 that debases dollar and reignites inflation. They are right. Will GOP pres candidates go King Dollar? Palin did.
Tea P wants big spending cuts. Deficit commish good start. Newt G mistaken to attack it on MTP. We need courage to stop bankruptcy.
If retail sales and production beat expecs, then dollar will go up not down this week. Euro in troubled Ireland. QE2 sent bond rates up!
So far no formal GOP response to deficit commish. Why? Tea P wants even bigger spending cuts. So do I.  Slash and burn deficit spending.
Fed QE2 starts today with $105b bond purchase. How low the dollar, how high inflation? Only Obama and Bernanke support it.
Deficit commish would repeal AMT. This is a HUGE pro-growth tax cut. One of most powerful. Paul Ryan on CNBC Kudlow tonight.
Dems hate deficit commish b/c of spending cuts. GOP should play ball w/commish for even BIGGER spending cuts. We need a $1T slash & burn.

The great Tom Sowell tonight on CNBC Kudlow. We'll talk first principles for free market economic freedom and prosperity. I'm honored.
Deficit commish moves ball in right direction. Should be tougher on spending and real flat tax reform. Should have King Dollar. OK start.
Most powerful tax cuts from landmark study by Gary and Aldonna Robbins of Treasury:capgains, faster depreciaiton, corp rate, estate, IRA.
Palin-led GOP revolt against Bernanke's QE2 may pin his ears back and restrict his plan. Bernanke's on the run. He's under siege. Good.
Bernanke QE2 now a political football. Palin-led GOP oppose. Obama Dems support. Never seen this before. Fed will have to back off soon.
Palin's QE2 attack on NRO is spot on. Other GOP leaders should get on this. Including oil drill. But add King Dollar, linked to gold.

World Bank Zoellick is right to call for gold back in the global monetary system as a reference point for inflation. New Bretton Woods.
I'm a big Palin supporter. Great conservative message. Great lady. But she needs to revise and extend her Reagan comments on Fox.
Obama radio comes out for temp extension of all Bush tax cuts, but not permanent. OK. 2-3 years OK by me. Then flat tax reform, x loopholes.
Freeze Bush tax rates. 5% tax to repatriate foreign profits. Cut corp tax. 100% biz cash expensing. $100b budget cut. That's growth plan.

Government budget-cutting austerity = private sector prosperity.

Dems Coons and Manchin, and GOP Kirk, all pledged to vote for all Bush tax rate extension, even wealthy. They get seated for lame duck.Good.
New triangle: Obama, Reid, Boehner. How is this gonna work? Different than 94. 2:1 against Boehner. GOP must stick to tea party principles.
I want to know what the lame duck agenda will be. Bush tax rates? Spending cuts? This is crucial to investor and business confidence.
GOP landslide bullish for dollar. But QE2 is bearish. Will GOP adopt a King Dollar policy?  Low tax-rates need King Dollar to work.
Will a big tea party turnout carry Republicans to the Senate? Intrade is now showing a toss-up. That's new.
Message to GOP: Make case that spending cuts are good for growth and confidence. Think Britain. Sell this, along with tax cut extension.
Politico hatchet job on Palin, without source names, is a disgrace. Saw her on Fox. Totally on message. She's  treasure for new TP GOP.
Obama plan to decouple middle and wealthy/investor tax cuts is a loser. GOP won't do it. All Bush tax cuts will be extended post Nov. 2.
Look carefully at GDP: It's a growth recession, with inflation rising. Mini stagflation. Final economic nail in Dem political coffin.
Fed's going to sacrifice dollar on Phillips curve alter. Raising inflation in futile effort to reduce unemployment. Wrong in 70s. Wrong now.

Gallup has likely voters 55-40 for GOP in generic Congressional vote. OMG. Tsunami. Might this mean Senate too? Stocks will explode higher.
Gov. Rendell squares off against Sen. Coburn on voter revolt over stimulus and Obamacare. No recovery. Repeal Obamacare. CNBC Kudlow at 7.
GOP House plan to slam $100B in spending cuts, along w/ Bush tax rate freeze, is exactly right. Sends an important, early message.
Cautious Fed. QE2-lite according to WSJ/Hilsenrath. Good. Listening to markets for dollar and gold. Don't need QE2, but small beats big.
PJ ORourke brilliant tonight on show. This is not an election, it's a restraining order. The Obama plague of A students. No horse sense. Yup
PJ O'Rourke on Kudlow Report tonight on CNBC at 7 et. He's bullish on GOP takeover. But how will things really change,PJ? Personal liberty?
Mike Pence to leave House leadership to run for president, according to Politico. If so, I wish Mike all best. Totally great American.

Negative real yield on inflation protected bonds. Never happened before. Shows inflation worries. Fed QE2? Totally nuts.
Stocks doing well. Almost back to pre-Lehman. Signaling 2011 better for econ and politics. USA healing. But GOP needs King Dollar policy.
Supply-sider Pat Toomey has a 5-point lead over Sestak in PA Senate race. Huge. He's on Kudlow Report tonight. CNBC. 7pm ET.

Linda McMahon pulls w/i 5 of Blumenthal in CT acc to Rasmussen. She's running a great campaign on jobs/econ. This race could decide Senate.

Why not Sen. Judd Gregg for president? He's a supply-side budget hawk with tremendous knowledge & stature. He'd add enormously to GOP race.

Save the country by privatizing Fannie/Freddie. End "Bailout Nation" before they totally sink the rest of us. Free market housing can work.

The pessimism's gone too far. Double-dip calls abound. Yes, tax wall in 2011. Yes, soft patch right now.  But don't buy all the pessimism.
We need to stop blaming China for our problems. We need to stop over-taxing, over-spending, over-regulating. Our problems are homegrown.
